intro: Psychotria vogeliana var. bipindensis, commonly known as the African coffee plant, is a species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen, glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
